meanings.definition: To have viewed or seen something in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prevued the movie before it was released.
meanings.sent2: He prevued the report before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The detective prevued the crime scene and solved the case easily.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition prevued the danger lurking ahead.
meanings.sent5: By prevuing the obstacles, they were able to plan a successful route.

meanings.definition: To have been shown or presented in advance.
meanings.sent1: The trailer prevued the upcoming movie.
meanings.sent2: The teacher prevued the lesson for the next day.
meanings.sent3: The magician prevued his tricks to the audience, but they were still amazed.
meanings.sent4: The artist's sketch prevued the masterpiece that would follow.
meanings.sent5: The map prevued the path through the forest, guiding them safely.
